title: Heidi Allen announces she will not stand in general election because 'Brexit has broken politics'
text:
The Liberal Democrat MP Heidi Allen has become the latest member to announce she will stand down at the next election, saying that “Brexit has broken politics” in the UK.

Ms Allen is one of 37 MPs who will not contest their seats, prompting a rush within the major parties to find candidates to replace them before the late November deadline.

Nine Labour MPs, 13 Tories and three Liberal Democrats have said they will not stand again, plus 10 independent MPs, including former Tory rebels who had party whip withdrawn for supporting the Benn Act.

Ms Allen’s announcement leaves the Liberal Democrats in need of a replacement candidate.

The law requires all candidates to be nominated nineteen days before...
description: The Liberal Democrat MP Heidi Allen has become the latest member to announce she will stand down at the next election, saying that “Brexit has broken politics” in the UK.
